chapter.heading: Connecticut Home Care Program for Elders

section.heading: Pilot program to address human services needs in the northeastern region. Regional human services negotiating council

content.p: There is established for the northeastern region a pilot program to address the human services needs of such region. The pilot program shall allow local governments in partnership with public and private providers of human services and human service users, educators, business and other appropriate individuals or groups to establish a program to address the human services needs of the northeastern region. The goals of the pilot program shall be to

implement a regional partnership strategy that allows the northeastern region to coordinate programs and carry out the complex, sensitive and lengthy process of community-based planning based on a unified vision that results in strengthening the community;
achieve opportunities for all persons in the community; and
incorporate the principles of caring, prevention and healing.
Decisions in the development and implementation of the five-year strategic plan developed under section17a-753shall be made through a negotiated investment strategy as provided in section17a-752.
The pilot program shall include the establishment of a regional human services negotiating council made up of five sectors:
Local, state and federal elected officials servicing the northeastern region;
public and private human service providers from the northeastern region;
persons who shall include, but not be limited to, educators and representatives of labor and of business; and
state and federal agencies involved in human services. The negotiating council shall prepare the plan required under section17a-753.

Sectors and teams shall establish a schedule and procedures. Each team shall have one vote in the decisions of the negotiating council. The five-year strategic plan developed under section17a-753shall not be effective unless unanimously approved by the negotiating council.
